alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 21 at 2:52AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Central and Southeast Los Angeles. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 248 AM PST, gauge reports and radar indicated heavy rain showers spreading across the area. This activity will continue through the morning hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, Downtown Los Angeles, Griffith Park, Hollywood, Alhambra, Universal City, Inglewood, Burbank, Beverly Hills, Culver City, Pasadena, North Hollywood, Venice, Santa Monica, Manhattan Beach, Torrance, Hermosa Beach, Whittier and Van Nuys. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
